    • Deer

      public Deer(String species, double offspringChance, int x, int y)
      Constructs a Deer object with the specified species, offspring chance, and position.
      Parameters:
      species - the species of the deer
      offspringChance - the chance of deer reproduction
      x - the x-coordinate position of the deer
      y - the y-coordinate position of the deer

  • Method Details

    • getStaticID

      public int getStaticID(ACritter ID)

    • scanEnvironment

      public Integer scanEnvironment(String objectName)
      Scans the surrounding 3x3 grid centered on the current object's coordinates (this.x, this.y) within a map. It checks if a specific object (identified by objectName) exists in any of the surrounding cells, excluding the current object's cell. If the specified object is found, the method returns the object's ID. If the object is not found, the method returns 0.
      Specified by:
      scanEnvironment in interface Critters
      Overrides:
      scanEnvironment in class ACritter
      Parameters:
      objectName - The name of the object to be searched for in the surrounding environment.
      Returns:
      Integer The ID of the object if it is found in the surrounding cells, or 0 if the object is not found or if any of the surrounding cells are invalid (e.g., out of map bounds or containing null).
